title: Joe Esposito (singer)
text:
Joe "Bean" Esposito (born May 5, 1948) is an American <a href="singing">singer</a>/<a href="songwriter">songwriter</a> whose career spans from the 1970s to the present day. Esposito's songs have been recorded by <a href="Donna%20Summer">Donna Summer</a>, <a href="Aretha%20Franklin">Aretha Franklin</a>, <a href="Patti%20Labelle">Patti Labelle</a>, <a href="Stephen%20Stills">Stephen Stills</a> and others.
Biography.
Esposito was a member of the band <a href="Brooklyn%20Dreams%20%28group%29">Brooklyn Dreams</a>, best known for their collaboration with <a href="Donna%20Summer">Donna Summer</a> on "<a href="Heaven%20Knows%20%28Donna%20Summer%20song%29">Heaven Knows</a>" and "<a href="Bad%20Girls%20%28Donna%20Summer%20song%29">Bad Girls</a>." <a href="Giorgio%20Moroder">Giorgio Moroder</a> asked Esposito to collaborate on his 1982 "Solitary Men" project, which became Esposito's first solo album.
In the 1980s, he is best known for his performances of the hit songs "<a href="Flashdance%20%28soundtrack%29">Lady, Lady, Lady</a>" from the "Solitary Men" album and the 1983 film "<a href="Flashdance%20%28soundtrack%29">Flashdance</a>", & "<a href="You%27re%20the%20Best">You're the Best</a>" from the 1984 film "<a href="The%20Karate%20Kid%20%281984%20film%29">The Karate Kid</a>".
Esposito was nominated at the <a href="Grammys">Grammys</a> in 1984 for Album of the Year ("<a href="Flashdance%20%28soundtrack%29">Flashdance</a>") and Best Motion Picture Soundtrack ("<a href="Staying%20Alive%20%28soundtrack%20album%29">Staying Alive</a>"). In 1988, <a href="Brenda%20Russell">Brenda Russell</a> and Esposito were nominated as Best Pop Duo for "<a href="Piano%20in%20the%20Dark">Piano in the Dark</a>", as he also supplied vocals on the song. Also in 1988, he sang a duet with <a href="Laura%20Branigan">Laura Branigan</a> on the song "<a href="Come%20into%20My%20Life%20%28Laura%20Branigan%20and%20Joe%20Esposito%20song%29">Come into My Life</a>" from the "<a href="Coming%20to%20America">Coming to America</a>" soundtrack.
Personal life.
Esposito is the father of <a href="Mike%20Esposito%20%28baseball%29">Mike Esposito</a>, who pitched in 2005 for <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a>'s <a href="Colorado%20Rockies">Colorado Rockies</a>. He is also the father of Joey Esposito, Nicole Esposito and Shauna Esposito. He is married to Lynda Esposito.
Current work.
Esposito lives in Las Vegas where he performs as a vocalist at various casino hotels. During the early 1990s, he and Eddy Hokenson (of Brooklyn Dreams) toured with Kenny Vance and the Planotones, a vocal group created for the film "<a href="American%20Hot%20Wax">American Hot Wax</a>". In May 2013, Esposito became the lead singer for the Brooklyn Bridge band, formerly known as <a href="Johnny%20Maestro%20%26amp%3B%20the%20Brooklyn%20Bridge">Johnny Maestro & the Brooklyn Bridge</a>.
